716ed147db7f4a11aed2832a51e72924 (01:31): Anyway to restrict the number of characters put into a text area?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:34): `css width @ jMCg    using width or height
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (01:34): jMCg using width or height, css width: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/visudet.html#propdef-width
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:34): if you mean, like a maxlength for a textarea, then youu'd need js :)
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:34): rather easy to do though
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:35): jMCg:    <textarea onkeyup="(this.value.length==80) ? false : true)"> this will only hold 80 chars </textarea>
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:36): that works when typing in, not pasting, for pasting, you can do an onchange
716ed147db7f4a11aed2832a51e72924 (01:40): CommandPrompt, with the same this.value.length thing?
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:40): yes and no
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:41): onchange will trigger when the mouse gets out of the texteara
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:41): so, onchange, trim it to whatever lenght you want
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:44): jMCg:    <textarea onchange="(this.value.length==80) ? this.value=this.value.length.slice(0,80) : true"> this will only hold 80 chars </textarea>
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (01:44): like so
716ed147db7f4a11aed2832a51e72924 (01:46): Great thanks CommandPrompt
